TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit InertiaExpansionBehavior extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Controls the deceleration of a resizing manipulation during inertia.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The InertiaExpansionBehavior class specifies how a expansion manipulation behaves when it is inertia. Use the <xref:System.Windows.Input.ManipulationInertiaStartingEventArgs.ExpansionBehavior%2A> property in the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.ManipulationInertiaStarting> event to do the following:
- Specify the initial velocity of the inertia when it begins by setting the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InertiaExpansionBehavior.InitialVelocity%2A> property.
- Specify the desired expansion of the manipulation when inertia ends by setting the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InertiaExpansionBehavior.DesiredExpansion%2A> property.
- Specify the desired deceleration of the inertia by setting the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InertiaExpansionBehavior.DesiredDeceleration%2A> property.
Set either the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InertiaExpansionBehavior.DesiredExpansion%2A> or the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InertiaExpansionBehavior.DesiredDeceleration%2A>, but not both. When you set one of these properties, the other property is changed to <xref:System.Double.NaN?displayProperty=fullName> if it has a value.
For more information about manipulations, see the [Input Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md). For an example of an application that responds to manipulations, see [Walkthrough: Creating Your First Touch Application](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Examples The following example shows the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.ManipulationInertiaStarting> event handler and sets the desired deceleration for translation, expansion, and rotation that is used during inertia. This example is part of a larger example in [Walkthrough: Creating Your First Touch Application](../Topic/Walkthrough:%20Creating%20Your%20First%20Touch%20Application.md).
[!code-cs[BasicManipulation#ManipulationInertiaStarting](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/basicmanipulation/mainwindow.xaml.cs#manipulationinertiastarting)] [!code-vb[BasicManipulation#ManipulationInertiaStarting](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/basicmanipulation/mainwindow.xaml.vb#manipulationinertiastarting)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Gets or sets the rate that resizing slows in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dipixel#plural](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] per square milliseconds.
Docs.value: The rate that resizing slows in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dipixel#plural](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] per square milliseconds. The default is <xref:System.Double?displayProperty=fullName>.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the DesiredDeceleration property to specify the desired deceleration of the inertia. Set either the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InertiaExpansionBehavior.DesiredExpansion%2A> or the DesiredDeceleration, but not both. When you set one of these properties, the other property is changed to <xref:System.Double.NaN?displayProperty=fullName> if it has a value.
For more information about manipulations, see the [Input Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md). For an example of an application that responds to manipulations, see [Walkthrough: Creating Your First Touch Application](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

Docs.exception:
The property is set to infinity.
-or-
The property is set to <xref:System.Double>.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the amount the element resizes at the end of inertia.
Docs.value: The amount the element resizes at the end of inertia. The default is a that has its <xref:System.Windows.Vector.X%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Vector.Y%2A> properties set to <xref:System.Double.NaN?displayProperty=fullName>.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the DesiredExpansion property to specify the desired expansion of the manipulation when inertia ends. Set either the DesiredExpansion or the <xref:System.Windows.Input.InertiaExpansionBehavior.DesiredDeceleration%2A>, but not both. When you set one of these properties, the other property is changed to <xref:System.Double.NaN?displayProperty=fullName> if it has a value.
For more information about manipulations, see the [Input Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md). For an example of an application that responds to manipulations, see [Walkthrough: Creating Your First Touch Application](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the initial average radius.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information about manipulations, see the [Input Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md). For an example of an application that responds to manipulations, see [Walkthrough: Creating Your First Touch Application](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the initial rate the element resizes at the start of inertia.
Docs.value: The initial rate the element resizes at the start of inertia.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information about manipulations, see the [Input Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md). For an example of an application that responds to manipulations, see [Walkthrough: Creating Your First Touch Application](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
